intro.description: This cheat sheet shows you how to select an item from a context menu which opens on a node in a tree.

item.title: Create a Test Case
item.description:
Create a Test Case called Select item from context menu on tree node.
Open the Test Case Editor for this Test Case.

item.title: Reference a Test Case to select a node from a tree
item.description:
From the unbound modules, browse to the category:
Actions (basic) > Select > Tree.

subitem.label: Select the Test Case "ub_tre_selectNode_byTextpath". Drag it into the Test Case Editor.

item.title: Enter the parameter details for the Test Case
item.description: You can find out what these parameters mean in the cheat sheet Learning to test trees

subitem.label: In the "path type" parameter field, enter: absolute
In the "Textpath" parameter field, enter: Category.*
In the "Operator" parameter field, enter: matches
In the "number of clicks" parameter field, enter: 1
In the "mouse button" parameter field, enter: 1. This means that the node will be selected using the left mouse button.
In the "Extend Selection" parameter field, enter: no. The extend selection parameter is to allow multi-selection, which is not required here.

item.title: Give the component a meaningful component name
item.description:
In the Test Case Editor, select the
ub_tre_selectNode_byTextpath Test Case.

subitem.label: In the component names view, in the "new name" field, enter "DVDTool_Category_tree" as the new component name.

item.title: Reference a Test Case to select an item from the context menu
item.description:
From the unbound modules, browse to the category:
Actions (basic) > Select > Context Menu .

subitem.label: Select the Test Case "ub_grc_selectContextMenuEntry_byTextpath". Drag it into the Test Case Editor.

item.title: Enter the parameter details for the Test Case
item.description: The Test Case to select from a context menu has three parameters.

subitem.label: In the "Textpath" parameter field, enter: Add category.*
In the "Operator" parameter field, enter: matches
In the "Mouse Button" parameter, enter 3 (the context menu will be opened using the right mouse button)

item.title: Enter the same component name
item.description:
In the component names view, in the "new name" field, enter "DVDTool_Category_tree" as the new component name.
Notice how you can use the same component name for different (but compatible) component types (e.g. tree and graphics component). This makes your test specification easier.

item.title: Save the Test Case editor
item.description: You now have a Test Case which will select the Category node in the tree, and then select Add category from the context menu.

item.title: Execute the test
item.description: Try this Test Case out on the DVD Tool. You will need to create a Test Suite, and add this Test Case to it. You may also need to carry out the object mapping and select the AUT you want to use in the Properties View for the Test Suite Editor.
